main event: A bright star-like object was observed in the northwest sky, moving southeast and reaching a maximum elevation overhead on January 4, 1962.
interesting points: The object was described as being the size of a dime at arm's length., The observation lasted approximately 1 minute., It moved at a flat trajectory with a slight dip in its path., No sound was reported during the observation., The characteristics of the object suggested it might be a meteor, corresponding to a probable meteor shower at that time.
witness description: The observation was made by an observer's assistant during early daylight conditions.
